title: Father And Son
opening: Myrrh returns safely to Ephraim's side. A noble warrior to the end, Selena fought with great honor, never once using Myrrh as a hostage. Ephraim renews his vow to pierce the veil of mystery surrounding the Grado Empire. Selena is added to the list of innocents who Grado must account for. The center of the Grado Empire. Emperor Vigarde should have been here, but...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Another tremor... They happen a lot, don't they? Are you all right, Myrrh?

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Yes, I was startled. Ephraim, this place... Did it always shake like this?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Yeah, Grado's been prone to earthquakes for a long time. Tiny tremors like that happen all the time. Don't worry.

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: I can feel it--from inside the castle, I can feel the darkness. I feel a broad pool of darkness deep within its walls.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Perhaps it's coming from the throne room. That's where Emperor Vigarde, the man who started this, is. Let's go.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Father... Have we been foolish? When you died, I couldn't accept the loss... I... If only I'd been stronger... Urgh!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Your Majesty! Enemy soldiers are headed this way! Oh, Prince--

intro.speaker: Lyon?
intro.line: ...Hi. What's wrong? Why such an unusual expression on your face? I'd rather you didn't look upon me as though I were some horrid beast.

intro.speaker: Lyon?
intro.line: Did you say we were under attack? I want all of you to strike the foe. Bring your weapons to bear on Ephraim. Is that acceptable, Father?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Oh, hello, it's you... What was your name again? Ah, yes, Knoll. You're one of my researchers. I've glad tidings for you. My father is back.

flashback.speaker: Knoll
flashback.line: Your... Your Majesty! This is incredible! Prince Lyon, what miracle is this? It cannot be! What--? What is that stone?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: This? This is the Dark Stone. It bears even more power than any Sacred Stone. I extracted and condensed all of the magic bound within the Fire Emblem. The Dark Stone's power is what gave my father back the spark of life.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Now that the Dark Stone is mine, I have no need for this empty husk.

flashback.speaker: Knoll
flashback.line: P-Prince Lyon! The Sacred Stone... What have you done?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: They are all in the way. The Sacred Stones, I mean. Four more remain, and they must all be destroyed. The only stone we need now is this Dark Stone of mine.

battle.speaker: Rennac
battle.line: Ha ha! The spectacular capital of Grado. The richest city on the continent. With my expert eye, I judge this card to be an incomparable treasure. Once this is all done, I think I'll just scamper off on my own...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: You there, hold.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Huh? ...You’re a man. Sorry, pal, but I’m not interested in men.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: What are you doing here in the castle? You seem to be weighed down a bit. Helping yourself to the treasure?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Ha! I’ve no idea what you’re talking about. Now, wait a minute... You couldn’t be... Aren’t you Prince Ephraim?!?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Hm? I’m Ephraim, but...

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: I-I thought so. You’re the one they call the Beast of Renais... I’ve heard tales of how you’ve looted and pillaged your way across the land...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: H-Hold on! Calm down! You won’t get any treasure by killing me. If you want these goods, it’ll cost you. 10,000 gold.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Yeah... Is that too high? Fine, then you get my sword as well. I’ll join your army. So that’s me and the treasure for only 9,980 gold! What do you say?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: You know, I have no idea how I got pulled into this conversation. 9,980 gold, eh? I haven’t decided yet...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Here’s 9,980 gold. Is this sufficient?

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Huh? M-may I really take it?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Sorry? You set the price yourself, didn’t you? Now that I’ve hired you, I intend to get my money’s worth.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: You..aren’t going to stab me once I’ve taken your money, are you? Once the fighting’s all done, you won’t burn me at the stake or anything?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: ...What rumors are these people spreading about me?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Aha! So this is where you’ve wandered off to, Rennac!

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Princess L’Arachel? Uh-oh, um...

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Come with me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Wait... Hold on now. Go with you where? Look, I’m sorry, but I’ve been hired by the Grado Empire, and... Hello! I’m talking to you!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Rennac, whatever is the matter? I promise to listen to your story later, but now, we must be going!

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: No, I’m no servant, like that kook Dozla. I’m a mercenary. I escorted you to Renais like I was hired to do, didn’t I? You have no right to drag me across creation without any pay whatsoever!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Is this about wages? I believe you’ve received ample compensation.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Ample?! Do you even know what that word means? You’re the princess of Rausten! I thought working for you would pay well! Yet your purse strings are knotted tight, and I’ve almost been killed so many–

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: The joy that comes from doing good is not something that can be purchased. There. All better? Let’s go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: NO! I said I don’t want to! Riding about with you is– ...And there she goes. Oh... By the Stones, why did I ever take that job in the first place?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel (Off-Screen)
recruit-talk.line: We must hurry, Rennac.

recruit-talk.speaker: Rennac
recruit-talk.line: Right, right. I’m coming...

boss.speaker: Ephraim
boss.line: Vigarde! Why did you invade Renais? Why did you kill my father?

boss.speaker: Ephraim
boss.line: Answer me, Vigarde! ...So you really have lost hold of your senses, haven't you?

boss.speaker: Duessel
boss.line: Your Majesty... It's too late, isn't it? ...Forgive me.

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: After that... His Majesty ordered the invasion of Renais, as Prince Lyon asked him to. Father McGregor grew concerned with Prince Lyon's health. He tried several times to dissuade him from his path. Prince Lyon executed him personally. I, too, was branded a traitor and arrested. My execution was scheduled for tomorrow.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Lyon... Where is he now?

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: Would that I knew. Prince Lyon frightens me now. He is...transformed...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: He's... Lyon is my friend.

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: This way, Prince Ephraim. I believe it's here...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: What is it? What is this place?

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: This is the former resting place of the Stone of Grado, the Fire Emblem. We've kept the Sacred Twins of Grado here as well. If we're still lucky, they may still be here.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: The Sacred Twins... Those are the ancient weapons once wielded by the founders of our nations. Let's see if I remember my studies... Emperor Grado's were the magic tome Gleipnir and Garm, the black axe.

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: That is correct. You know your history well.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Yeah, it's something I learned long ago from Lyon.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Well, let's see if they're still here, shall we?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Prince Ephraim. Here...I've found the Sacred Twin relics.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: And here they are... Yet I don't understand. The Sacred Stone was destroyed, but these were left untouched? Why?

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: I know not... Perhaps... No, never mind. It's an idle thought. Prince Ephraim, please take these relics with you.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Is that all right?

end.speaker: Knoll
end.line: Yes. I want you to have them. And maybe... Maybe someone else wanted you to have them as well.

end.speaker: Frelian
end.line: Prince Ephraim!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You've come at a good time, soldier. I want you to take a message to Frelia. Actually...

end.speaker: Frelian
end.line: We've received dire news from Jehanna! It's about Princess Eirika and Prince Innes... They're under attack by Grado forces led by Tiger Eye and Moonstone.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Eirika...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Caellach Tiger Eye and Valter Moonstone... They're supposed to be the most powerful of Grado's imperial generals. For them to have abandoned the capital and lead the battle into Jehanna...

end.speaker: Frelian
end.line: The Knights of Rausten have ridden to the eastern front to aid Frelia, but I fear for their survival.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We march for Jehanna immediately! We will rescue Eirika.

end.speaker: Frelian
end.line: B-but even if we leave now, we will not make it in time...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We will make it. Rest easy on that. Eirika is my sister. That one will never lay down her blade. And I am Eirika's brother. There is no way I'll let my sister die!
